ai.summary: The Minffordd Path is a gentle 4.3 km hike in the UK that winds through woodland and open moorland to a dramatic waterfall. With an easy gradient, it’s popular with beginners, families, and photographers seeking scenic upland scenery near Snowdonia National Park.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines forest tracks, grassy paths, and some stone steps. Expect occasional short climbs and uneven ground; after rain the path can be muddy and slippery. Some sections may be exposed to wind, especially near the waterfall.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear suitable for uneven or slippery terrain. Weather in upland areas can change rapidly, so bring waterproofs and extra layers. Stay on marked paths and supervise children; there are exposed drops and loose rock in places. Mobile reception can be limited in remote sections, so plan ahead and let someone know your route. Allow extra time for slower sections and wet conditions.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking boots with good grip
Map, compass or offline trail app
Hat and gloves if conditions are cool
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) is ideal, with longer days and milder weather, though conditions can still change rapidly in the mountains.
